title: Variables in Java

explanation.short: Java variables must be declared with a specific data type before use.
explanation.detailed: Java uses static typing, meaning you must declare the type of each variable. Once declared, a variable cannot change its type. Variables must be initialized before use. Java distinguishes between primitive types (int, double, boolean) and reference types (String, objects).

key_points: Semicolons required at end of statements
best_practices: Use descriptive names: userAge not ua
Use primitive types for performance when possible

common_mistakes.explanation: Variables must be initialized before use in Java
Cannot change variable type after declaration
All statements in Java must end with semicolon
